title: Authors and Citation
text: James O. Uanhoro. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Uanhoro J (2024). bayesianmasem: Bayesian meta-analytic structural equation modeling focus latent variable models. R package version 0.2.0.9001, https://jamesuanhoro.github.io/bayesianmasem/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {bayesianmasem: Bayesian meta-analytic structural equation modeling with a focus on latent variable models},   author = {James O. Uanhoro},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.2.0.9001},   url = {https://jamesuanhoro.github.io/bayesianmasem/}, }

title: Bayesian meta-analytic structural equation modeling with a focus on latent variable models
text: Package overview Features Installation example Citations

title: Bayesian meta-analytic structural equation modeling with a focus on latent variable models
text: package Bayesian meta-analytic structural equation models (MASEM, Cheung Chan 2009), specifically meta-analysis confirmatory factor models. package fits fixed-, random- dependent-samples MASEMs.

title: Bayesian meta-analytic structural equation modeling with a focus on latent variable models
text: Features bayesianmasem include: Uses lavaan-style syntax model specification Fits fixed-effects, random-effects dependent-samples MASEM Allows fixing loadings known values constraining loadings equal Estimates minor factor influences (Uanhoro 2023), .e. full residual correlation matrix reflecting misspecification true shared correlation matrix Ability relax simple-structure, .e. allow estimation cross-loadings using shrinkage--zero priors leading accurate estimates interfactor correlations. Built atop Stan (efficient Bayesian sampler).

title: Bayesian meta-analytic structural equation modeling with a focus on latent variable models
text: bayesianmasem hosted GitHub, need remotes package install . also need install cmdstanr package CmdStan order use Stan. Instructions:
code: install.packages("remotes")  # install remotes  # next install cmdstanr and CmdStan: install.packages(   "cmdstanr",   repos = c("https://mc-stan.org/r-packages/", getOption("repos")) ) cmdstanr::check_cmdstan_toolchain(fix = TRUE) cmdstanr::install_cmdstan()  # Then finally bayesianmasem: remotes::install_github("jamesuanhoro/bayesianmasem")

title: Bayesian meta-analytic structural equation modeling with a focus on latent variable models
text: use example Norton data (Norton et al. 2013). Let’s fit Zigmond-Snaith anxiety-depression model HADS assuming positive factor select items. 14 items. model assumes odd-numbered items load onto anxiety, even-numbered item load depression. Items 2, 4, 6, 7, 12, 14 load positive-wording factor, .e. method effect. assume loadings positive factor equal, factor assumed uncorrelated substantive factors. also specify items fixed loading 0 positive factor – helps relax simple structure, want ensure positive method factor 0 loading items. can fit random-effects model input correlation matrices provide sample size information. Norton13 data come metaSEM package (Cheung 2015): Setting method = "normal" implies true correlation matrix underlying data differs structured correlation matrix due minor factors. Setting simple_struc = FALSE allows cross-loadings estimated using priors attempt shrink cross-loadings 0. Parameters functions including bmasem() documented: ?bmasem.
code: model_syntax <- " anxiety =~ x1 + x3 + x5 + x7 + x9 + x11 + x13 depression =~ x2 + x4 + x6 + x8 + x10 + x12 + x14 pos =~ a * x2 + a * x4 + a * x6 + a * x7 + a * x12 + a * x14 pos =~ 0 * x1 + 0 * x3 + 0 * x5 + 0 * x8 + 0 * x9 + 0 * x10 + 0 * x11 + 0 * x13 pos ~~ 0 * anxiety + 0 * depression " fit_ad <- bmasem(   model_syntax,   sample_cov = Norton13$data, sample_nobs = Norton13$n,   method = "normal", simple_struc = FALSE )

what: Studies on the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale. — Norton13
title: Studies on the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale. — Norton13
text: data set includes 28 studies 14 items measuring Hospital Anxiety Depression Scale (HADS) Reported Norton et al. (2013) , data documentation copied metaSEM package (Cheung 2015) .

title: Studies on the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale. — Norton13
Studies on the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale. — Norton13
text: list data following structure: data list 28 studies correlation matrices. variables 14 items (x1 x14) measuring HADS n vector sample sizes population vector population data group vector classification patients vs. non-patients based population

title: Studies on the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale. — Norton13
text: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/metaSEM/index.html

title: Studies on the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale. — Norton13
text: Cheung MW (2015). “metaSEM: R Package Meta-Analysis using Structural Equation Modeling.” Frontiers Psychology, 5(1521). doi:10.3389/fpsyg.2014.01521 . Norton S, Cosco T, Doyle F, Done J, Sacker (2013). “Hospital Anxiety Depression Scale: meta confirmatory factor analysis.” Journal Psychosomatic Research, 74(1), 74--81. ISSN 0022-3999, doi:10.1016/j.jpsychores.2012.10.010 .

title: The 'bayesianmasem' package. — bayesianmasem-package
text: package Bayesian meta-analytic structural equation models (MASEMs), specifically confirmatory factor models. package fits fixed-, random- dependent-samples MASEMs.

what: A class for models fitted with the package. — bmasem-class
title: A class for models fitted with the package. — bmasem-class
text: class models fitted package.

title: A class for models fitted with the package. — bmasem-class
text: major_parameters Summary statistics structural parameters. minor_factor_matrix Summary statistics standardized residual covariances. data_list Data used fit model. priors Priors used fit model. stan_fit Fitted CmdStan model. version Package version used fit model.

what: Fit random-effects Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs with minor factors assumed. — bmasem
title: Fit random-effects Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs with minor factors assumed. — bmasem
text: function fit fixed-, random-effects, clustered Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs minor factors assumed. yet accomodate moderators, correlation matrices must complete. change near future.

title: Fit random-effects Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs with minor factors assumed. — bmasem
code: bmasem(   model = NULL,   data = NULL,   group = NULL,   sample_cov = NULL,   sample_nobs = NULL,   correlation = TRUE,   method = "normal",   type = "re",   orthogonal = FALSE,   simple_struc = TRUE,   x_mat = NULL,   seed = 12345,   warmup = 1000,   sampling = 1000,   refresh = (warmup + sampling)/10,   adapt_delta = 0.9,   max_treedepth = 10,   chains = 3,   ncores = max(parallel::detectCores() - 2, 1),   priors = new_bmasempriors(),   show = TRUE,   show_messages = TRUE,   cluster = NULL )

title: Fit random-effects Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs with minor factors assumed. — bmasem
text: model description user-specified model, lavaan syntax. data optional data frame containing observed variables used model. group optional string identifying grouping variable data object. sample_cov (list matrices) sample covariance correlation matrices. rownames /colnames must contain observed variable names. now, assumes missing elements covariance matrices. sample_nobs (vector positive integer) Number observations study. correlation (LOGICAL) TRUE (default): analyze correlation matrices based logarithm matrix transformation (Archakov Hansen 2021) ; FALSE: analyze covariance matrices methods (Uanhoro 2023) . method (character) One "normal", "lasso", "logistic", "GDP", "none". See details . type (character) One "fe", "re", "dep" fixed-effects, random-effects, dependent-samples MASEM respectively. "dep" argument experimental, see details . orthogonal (LOGICAL) TRUE: constrain factors orthogonal (overrides model syntax); FALSE (default): according model syntax. simple_struc (LOGICAL) relevant CFAs. TRUE (default): assume simple structure; FALSE: estimate cross-loadings using generalized x_mat (data.frame) Meta-analytic predictors. row contains data group column variable. Column names labelled. seed (positive integer) seed, set obtain replicable results. warmup (positive integer) number warmup iterations run per chain. sampling (positive integer) number post-warmup iterations run per chain, retained inference. refresh (positive integer) often print status sampler. adapt_delta (real (0, 1)) Increase resolve divergent transitions. max_treedepth (positive integer) Increase resolve problems maximum tree depth. chains (positive integer) number Markov chains run. ncores (positive integer) number chains run parallel. priors object bmasempriors-class. See new_bmasempriors information. show (Logical) TRUE, show table results, FALSE, show table results. example, use FALSE simulation studies. show_messages (Logical) TRUE, show messages Stan sampler, FALSE, hide messages. cluster optional integer vector identifying cluster group belongs . Asssume five groups, first three belong cluster 1 last two belong cluster 2, argument : cluster = c(1, 1, 1, 2, 2). feature experimental, see details .

title: Fit random-effects Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs with minor factors assumed. — bmasem
text: object bmasem-class

title: Fit random-effects Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs with minor factors assumed. — bmasem
text: CFAs assume standardized factors. Latent variable regression models yet implemented. different methods estimating models package: normal: belief minor factor influences average zero continuous deviations away zero. lasso: belief minor factor influences largely zero small number non-zero residual covariances. logistic: similar belief normal readily accomodates extreme outliers. GDP: mimic global-local approach, .e. attempt shrink near 0 residual covariances 0 minimal shrinking larger residual covariances (Armagan et al. 2013) . none: intending ignore influence minor factors. type = "dep", user must supply cluster IDs, see cluster parameter documentation . However, feature experimental. Additionally, cluster inputs validated.

title: Fit random-effects Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs with minor factors assumed. — bmasem
text: Archakov , Hansen PR (2021). “New Parametrization Correlation Matrices.” Econometrica, 89(4), 1699--1715. ISSN 1468-0262, doi:10.3982/ECTA16910 , https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.3982/ECTA16910. Armagan , Dunson DB, Lee J (2013). “Generalized double Pareto shrinkage.” Statistica Sinica, 23(1), 119--143. ISSN 1017-0405, https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3903426/. Uanhoro JO (2023). “Hierarchical Covariance Estimation Approach Meta-Analytic Structural Equation Modeling.” Structural Equation Modeling: Multidisciplinary Journal, 30(4), 532--546. ISSN 1070-5511, doi:10.1080/10705511.2022.2142128 , 2023-06-19.

title: Fit random-effects Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs with minor factors assumed. — bmasem
code: if (FALSE) { model_syntax <- "# latent variable definitions F1 =~ JP1 + JP2 + JP3 F2 =~ JN1 + JN2 + JN4 + JN4 F3 =~ TD1 + TD2" bmasem(   model_syntax,   sample_cov = issp89$data, sample_nobs = issp89$n ) model_syntax <- paste0(   "distress =~ ", paste0("x", 1:14, collapse = " + "), "\n",   "anxiety =~ ", paste0("x", seq(1, 14, 2), collapse = " + "), "\n",   "depression =~ ", paste0("x", seq(2, 14, 2), collapse = " + ") ) bmasem(   model_syntax,   sample_cov = Norton13$data, sample_nobs = Norton13$n, orthogonal = TRUE ) }

title: Pretty print model results — bmasem_plot
text: Plot model parameters

title: Pretty print model results — bmasem_plot
text: object (bmasem) object bmasem-class returned bmasem. type (character) Type plot: "trace" traceplots "hist" histograms. subset (character) Subset parameters: NULL (Default) showing estimated parameters; response used regular expressions subset parameters. can loading names types parameters. ... additional arguments relevant bayesplot function

title: Pretty print model results — bmasem_plot
text: bayesplot object

title: Pretty print model results — bmasem_plot
code: if (FALSE) { model_syntax <- paste0(   "distress =~ ", paste0("x", 1:14, collapse = " + "), "\n",   "anxiety =~ ", paste0("x", seq(1, 14, 2), collapse = " + "), "\n",   "depression =~ ", paste0("x", seq(2, 14, 2), collapse = " + ") ) bmasem(   model_syntax,   sample_cov = Norton13$data, sample_nobs = Norton13$n, orthogonal = TRUE ) bmasem_plot(fit) }

what: Fit random-effects Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs with minor factors assumed. — bmasem_stage_1
title: Fit random-effects Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs with minor factors assumed. — bmasem_stage_1
text: function pool correlation matrices permitting fixed-, random-effects, clustered-samples pooling. Correlation matrices must complete. change near future.

title: Fit random-effects Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs with minor factors assumed. — bmasem_stage_1
code: bmasem_stage_1(   sample_cov = NULL,   sample_nobs = NULL,   type = "re",   seed = 12345,   warmup = 1000,   sampling = 1000,   refresh = (warmup + sampling)/10,   adapt_delta = 0.9,   max_treedepth = 10,   chains = 3,   ncores = max(parallel::detectCores() - 2, 1),   priors = new_bmasempriors(),   show = TRUE,   show_messages = TRUE,   cluster = NULL )

title: Fit random-effects Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs with minor factors assumed. — bmasem_stage_1
text: sample_cov (list matrices) sample covariance correlation matrices. rownames /colnames must contain observed variable names. now, assumes missing elements covariance matrices. sample_nobs (vector positive integer) Number observations study. type (character) One "fe", "re", "dep" fixed-effects, random-effects, dependent-samples MASEM respectively. "dep" argument experimental, see details . seed (positive integer) seed, set obtain replicable results. warmup (positive integer) number warmup iterations run per chain. sampling (positive integer) number post-warmup iterations run per chain, retained inference. refresh (positive integer) often print status sampler. adapt_delta (real (0, 1)) Increase resolve divergent transitions. max_treedepth (positive integer) Increase resolve problems maximum tree depth. chains (positive integer) number Markov chains run. ncores (positive integer) number chains run parallel. priors object bmasempriors-class. See new_bmasempriors information. show (Logical) TRUE, show table results, FALSE, show table results. example, use FALSE simulation studies. show_messages (Logical) TRUE, show messages Stan sampler, FALSE, hide messages. cluster optional integer vector identifying cluster group belongs . Asssume five groups, first three belong cluster 1 last two belong cluster 2, argument : cluster = c(1, 1, 1, 2, 2). feature experimental, see details .

title: Fit random-effects Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs with minor factors assumed. — bmasem_stage_1
text: list containing fit indices, pooled correlation matrix, asymptotic covariance matrix, Stan object data_list used fit Stan object

title: Fit random-effects Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs with minor factors assumed. — bmasem_stage_1
text: type = "dep", user must supply cluster IDs, see cluster parameter documentation . However, feature experimental. Additionally, cluster inputs validated.

text: references Rd macro \insertAllCites help page.

title: Fit random-effects Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs with minor factors assumed. — bmasem_stage_1
code: if (FALSE) { pool_fit <- bmasem_stage_1(   sample_cov = issp89$data, sample_nobs = issp89$n ) pool_fit$r_mat pool_fit$r_mat_cov }

what: Fit random-effects Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs with minor factors assumed. — bmasem_stage_2

text: function takes pooled correlation matrix object returns fitted SEM.

title: Fit random-effects Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs with minor factors assumed. — bmasem_stage_2
code: bmasem_stage_2(   model = NULL,   pool_fit = NULL,   method = "normal",   orthogonal = FALSE,   simple_struc = TRUE,   seed = 12345,   warmup = 1000,   sampling = 1000,   refresh = (warmup + sampling)/10,   adapt_delta = 0.9,   max_treedepth = 10,   chains = 3,   ncores = max(parallel::detectCores() - 2, 1),   priors = new_bmasempriors(),   show = TRUE,   show_messages = TRUE,   cluster = NULL )

title: Fit random-effects Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs with minor factors assumed. — bmasem_stage_2
text: model description user-specified model, lavaan syntax. pool_fit list returned bmasem_stage_1 function. method (character) One "normal", "lasso", "logistic", "GDP", "none". See details . orthogonal (LOGICAL) TRUE: constrain factors orthogonal (overrides model syntax); FALSE (default): according model syntax. simple_struc (LOGICAL) relevant CFAs. TRUE (default): assume simple structure; FALSE: estimate cross-loadings using generalized seed (positive integer) seed, set obtain replicable results. warmup (positive integer) number warmup iterations run per chain. sampling (positive integer) number post-warmup iterations run per chain, retained inference. refresh (positive integer) often print status sampler. adapt_delta (real (0, 1)) Increase resolve divergent transitions. max_treedepth (positive integer) Increase resolve problems maximum tree depth. chains (positive integer) number Markov chains run. ncores (positive integer) number chains run parallel. priors object bmasempriors-class. See new_bmasempriors information. show (Logical) TRUE, show table results, FALSE, show table results. example, use FALSE simulation studies. show_messages (Logical) TRUE, show messages Stan sampler, FALSE, hide messages. cluster optional integer vector identifying cluster group belongs . Asssume five groups, first three belong cluster 1 last two belong cluster 2, argument : cluster = c(1, 1, 1, 2, 2). feature experimental, see details .

title: Fit random-effects Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs with minor factors assumed. — bmasem_stage_2
text: object bmasem-class

title: Fit random-effects Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs with minor factors assumed. — bmasem_stage_2
text: CFAs assume standardized factors. Latent variable regression models yet implemented. different methods estimating models package: normal: belief minor factor influences average zero continuous deviations away zero. lasso: belief minor factor influences largely zero small number non-zero residual covariances. logistic: similar belief normal readily accomodates extreme outliers. GDP: mimic global-local approach, .e. attempt shrink near 0 residual covariances 0 minimal shrinking larger residual covariances (Armagan et al. 2013) . none: intending ignore influence minor factors.

title: Fit random-effects Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs with minor factors assumed. — bmasem_stage_2
text: Armagan , Dunson DB, Lee J (2013). “Generalized double Pareto shrinkage.” Statistica Sinica, 23(1), 119--143. ISSN 1017-0405, https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3903426/.

title: Fit random-effects Bayesian meta-analytic CFAs with minor factors assumed. — bmasem_stage_2
code: if (FALSE) { pool_fit_issp <- bmasem_stage_1(   sample_cov = issp89$data, sample_nobs = issp89$n ) model_syntax_issp <- "# latent variable definitions F1 =~ JP1 + JP2 + JP3 F2 =~ JN1 + JN2 + JN4 + JN4 F3 =~ TD1 + TD2" bmasem_stage_2(model_syntax_issp, pool_fit_issp) pool_fit_norton <- bmasem_stage_1(   sample_cov = Norton13$data, sample_nobs = Norton13$n ) model_syntax_norton <- paste0(   "distress =~ ", paste0("x", 1:14, collapse = " + "), "\n",   "anxiety =~ ", paste0("x", seq(1, 14, 2), collapse = " + "), "\n",   "depression =~ ", paste0("x", seq(2, 14, 2), collapse = " + ") ) bmasem_stage_2(model_syntax_norton, pool_fit_norton, orthogonal = TRUE) }

what: A class for setting up priors. — bmasempriors-class
title: A class for setting up priors. — bmasempriors-class
text: class setting priors.

title: A class for setting up priors. — bmasempriors-class
text: lkj_shape (positive real) shape parameter LKJ-prior interfactor correlation matrix confirmatory factor models. ml_par (real) location parameter normal prior loadings. sl_par (positive real) scale parameter normal prior loadings. rs_par (positive real) scale parameter Student-t(3,0,) prior residual standard deviations. rc_par (positive real) shape parameter Beta(rc_par, rc_par) prior residual error correlations. mr_par (real) location parameter normal prior log-RMSEA. sr_par (positive real) scale parameter normal prior log-RMSEA. br_par (positive real) scale parameter normal prior regression coefficients log-RMSEA. rm_par (positive real) scale parameter normal prior tau / CRMR parameter.

title: Stan data helper function — .create_data_list_meta
text: lavaan_object lavaan fit object corresponding model method (character) One "normal", "lasso", "logistic", "GDP", "none". See details . type (character) One "fe", "re", "dep" fixed-effects, random-effects, dependent-samples MASEM respectively. "dep" argument experimental, see details . simple_struc (LOGICAL) relevant CFAs. TRUE (default): assume simple structure; FALSE: estimate cross-loadings using generalized priors object bmasempriors-class. See new_bmasempriors information. cluster optional integer vector identifying cluster group belongs . Asssume five groups, first three belong cluster 1 last two belong cluster 2, argument : cluster = c(1, 1, 1, 2, 2). feature experimental, see details . correlation (LOGICAL) TRUE (default): analyze correlation matrices based logarithm matrix transformation (Archakov Hansen 2021) ; FALSE: analyze covariance matrices methods (Uanhoro 2023) . partab lavaan parameter table output ceq.simple & std.lv = TRUE x_mat (data.frame) Meta-analytic predictors. row contains data group column variable. Column names labelled.

title: Set priors in package — new_bmasempriors
text: Modify default priors package.

title: Set priors in package — new_bmasempriors
code: new_bmasempriors(   lkj_shape = 2,   ml_par = 0,   sl_par = 0.5,   rs_par = 1,   rc_par = 2,   mr_par = log(0.8),   sr_par = 0.7,   br_par = 0.5,   rm_par = 0.15 )

title: Set priors in package — new_bmasempriors
text: lkj_shape (positive real) shape parameter LKJ-prior interfactor correlation matrix confirmatory factor models. ml_par (real) location parameter normal prior loadings. sl_par (positive real) scale parameter normal prior loadings. rs_par (positive real) scale parameter Student-t(3,0,) prior residual standard deviations. rc_par (positive real) shape parameter Beta(rc_par, rc_par) prior residual error correlations. mr_par (real) location parameter normal prior log-RMSEA. sr_par (positive real) scale parameter normal prior log-RMSEA. br_par (positive real) scale parameter normal prior regression coefficients log-RMSEA. rm_par (positive real) scale parameter normal prior tau / CRMR parameter.

title: Set priors in package — new_bmasempriors
text: object bmasempriors-class

title: Set priors in package — new_bmasempriors
code: if (FALSE) { # Change LKJ shape parameter only custom_priors <- new_bmasempriors(lkj_shape = 1.0) model_syntax <- paste0(   "distress =~ ", paste0("x", 1:14, collapse = " + "), "\n",   "anxiety =~ ", paste0("x", seq(1, 14, 2), collapse = " + "), "\n",   "depression =~ ", paste0("x", seq(2, 14, 2), collapse = " + ") ) bmasem(   model_syntax,   sample_cov = Norton13$data, sample_nobs = Norton13$n, orthogonal = TRUE,   priors = custom_priors ) }

title: Pretty print model results — pp_summary
text: Nice printing model results, optionally produces HTML document

title: Pretty print model results — pp_summary
code: pp_summary(object, interval = 0.9, digits = 3, simple = TRUE, save_html = NULL)

title: Pretty print model results — pp_summary
text: object (bmasem) object bmasem-class returned bmasem. interval (real (0, 1)) Credible interval return. digits (positive integer) Number decimal places print table simple (Logical) TRUE produce table less information parameters; FALSE: produces table information save_html (string) Optional file name save table HTML

title: Pretty print model results — pp_summary
code: if (FALSE) { model_syntax <- paste0(   "distress =~ ", paste0("x", 1:14, collapse = " + "), "\n",   "anxiety =~ ", paste0("x", seq(1, 14, 2), collapse = " + "), "\n",   "depression =~ ", paste0("x", seq(2, 14, 2), collapse = " + ") ) bmasem(   model_syntax,   sample_cov = Norton13$data, sample_nobs = Norton13$n, orthogonal = TRUE ) pp_summary(fit) pp_summary(fit, simple = FALSE) }
